text: [Applause]
before this inoculation Donald Trump
compared America's intelligence agencies
to Nazis now he's their boss and here at
CIA headquarters he's trying to rewrite

is that as you know I have a running war
with the media they are among the most

and they sort of made it sound like I
had a feud with the intelligence
community and I just want to let you
know there's a reason you're number one
stop it is exactly the opposite but this
was his own tweet just over a week ago
accusing the intelligence agencies of
spreading fake news attacking them with
the words are we living in Nazi Germany
it's impossible to reconcile these two
Trump's we're going to do great things
we're gonna do great things we've been
fighting these wars for longer than any

the real abilities that we have we've

Isis I have to get rid of Isis we have

in Myanmar the Foreign Secretary said he
was looking forward for doing business
with the new US leader the new president
has made it very clear that he wants to
put Britain at the front of the line for
a new trade you know obviously that's
extremely exciting and important but
Germany's leader had what sounded like a
coded warning for President Trump I
believe it's best if we work together
based on rules common values and joint
actions in international economics
international trade and military
alliances as global leaders and citizens
alike scramble to come to terms with the
reality of the new trump era it is clear
that the elevation to the most powerful
position in the west of a controversial
populist is having a big effect not just
here in the United States but around the
world
as president Trump was driven back to
the White House tonight protesters could
be seen from his motorcade and as he
entered the building on his first full
day in office their shouts would have
been ringing in his ears it's tough
being in charge James Cook BBC News
Washington
